reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel in May 2008. On the first night, I had cats staring at me whilst eating my dinner and then found an "animal whisker" in the beef stew! Of course, this put me off the food straight away and the rep took the "whisker" to the hotel manager. They then couldnt explain this and sent a "basket of fruit" to our room.. which consisted of 2 oranges, 4 strawberries and some dates!!!! They didnt want to take this further.
reviews.title: whisker in my food

reviews.text: Apart from this, the hotel was full of Russians and very few english. Entertainment was very poor, bingo, line dancing and a couples night!!!! If i wanted this, I would have stayed at home and went to the local social club!
reviews.title: Good Holiday

likes.liked: — The close proximity of the beach and pools

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: On the bright side, the staff were all lovely.. the maids worked really hard, our room was always clean and the restaurant staff were very helpful.. although they all expect a TIP!!
Weather in May was very poor.... very cloudy and hardly any sun.
reviews.title: a mixed review
Lovely Hotel all inclusive took some getting used to!
reviews.text: Resort overall is "ok" !!!! wouldn't go back due to the hassle from all of the Tunisian men !

reviews.title: brilliant
reviews.text: have just returned from spending 2 weeks at this hotel and we can't wait to go back. The rooms are a good size and the beds are king size. The food can be repetiive but there is always plenty to choose from. The staff are always ready to help and very thing is spotless.

reviews.title: excellent family holiday
reviews.text: Just returned from a weeks holiday at the Tour Khalef, we took our three teenage children and to be honest only booked because it was cheap and had limited expectations, however we had a fantastic time and would recommend Tunisia, the resort and the Hotel for family and friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel even though below British four star standards was an exceptional one with clean rooms, public areas, pool and beach and had extremely helpful staff at reception, in the restaurant and at the poolside.
reviews.title: Had a great holiday

likes.disliked: — Prefer something more modern with more modern conveniences & better menus, choice of wine etc

reviews.text: One negative although not the fault of the tour operator or the hotel was the attitude of some of the guests from the eastern block who are rude and greedy, the tunisian staff do their very best to help and remain cheery and polite despite what was appauling treatment from these visitors to their country.
reviews.title: very good value for your money

reviews.text: We had a fantastic time, teenage children not bored, animation team lively and keen but not pushy, watersports excellent and cheap. Highlight of the holiday was the two day Sahara excursion, tiring but well worth it especially the camel ride at sunset and the amphitheatre at El Jem.
reviews.title: no way for stars hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a 2 or 3 star Hotel trying hard to be a 4 star. The Hotel makes sure that the usual things people complain about are at least up to standard. The food is quite acceptable and the rooms are kept very clean.
reviews.title: Bit run down, needs doing up.

reviews.text: Having said that, the Hotel is in the middle of nowhere. if you enjoy going out & about at night. You would have to get a taxi or Walk into Sousse at night if you wanted a drink anywhere other than the Hotel bar. The sister Hotel which you are able to use is even more boring than the Khalef, people mostly sitting round playing Cards.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Tour Khalef

likes.liked: — Quality of food and value for money
likes.disliked: — Tired bedrooms and indoor swimming pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Waiters are very reluctant to serve you if you don't tip them and will walk by you as if they haven't seen you. the bar area is populated with scruffy Tunisians all sat round a Television drinking. I tried to change channels one night when we were there on our own, and the barman shouted at me.
reviews.title: 2nd Class Citizen

likes.liked: — Hotel was bright and clean,rooms were a nice size as was the bathroom
likes.disliked: — Being treated differently as All inclusive to those on Half board. They were treated much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got there the staff insisted on taking our cases up to the room. We waited nearly an hour for ours, and ended up going down to fetch them ourselves, nearly missing Dinner in the process.
reviews.title: Very mixed feelings!

likes.liked: — Situated close to other good places to see
likes.disliked: — Smoke, shabbiness and the meat / eggs issue (see review)

reviews.text: The entertainment is bordering on abysmal. It seems to alternate between an "out of tune" local band, boring Bingo called out in several languages which seems to take an eternity. Line dancing
reviews.title: staff excellent

reviews.text: I have never felt so much at home, the hotel was lovely, clean, friendly and welcoming. the staff were lovely and so helpfull. me and my friend are 22yrs and 23 yrs old and enjoyed every minute. we will be going back in may as i miss the place already and have only been back 2days. the entertainment was top-notch, a good variety for the whole family. food was good a nice wide range.
reviews.title: didn't want to come home!
great place to stay
reviews.text: Leeanne Newcastle

hi , my name is jan and i have just returned from Tunisia after staying at the Tour Khalef in Souse which was fantastic and the best holiday me and my family have had for years. The hotel is stunnning and the staff can't do enough for you they will bend over backwards so that you have a relaxing stay there. The whole complex is amazing , the restaurant was lovely and food was great there was something for everyone plus waiters very helpfull and kind. The pool was gorgeous and pool side waiters are so great and will get you what ever you need especially one waiter who was fantastic his name is Fhalee . There is a brilliant shop around the pool for selling gifts, lylows, sunglasses, swimwear etc you name it they sell it and all very friendly and very helpfull. The rooms are lovely and clean with maid service every day , take a hair dryer as some rooms dont have one. Plenty to do and see and the weather is always good there apart from dec, january time but the rest of time is lovely. I took my two children and husband there and they loved it . Very family friendly.
reviews.title: Great family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've just returned from a week here with my husband and 2 children (aged 7 and 8).
reviews.title: Good value for money, highly recommended

likes.liked: — Great location for people prepared to walk 2km along the lovely beach to the lively Sousse centre.
likes.disliked: — Too many Russians at the hotel who were very rude and selfish.

reviews.title: Great hotel!
reviews.text: On arrival we were impressed with the spacious and clean reception/lounge area, decorated in a tradtional moorish style. Everywhere was very clean and air-conditioned. Check in was very speedy, which we were pleased about, given that we arrived at 1am.
